visualization_prompt: Generate a stacked column chart visualizing ocean depth zones with thickness proportions using gradient color encoding

title.text: Ocean Depth Zones by Vertical Proportion

series.name: Sunlight Zone
series.info: Epipelagic layer with sufficient sunlight for photosynthesis. Contains 90% of marine life.

series.name: Twilight Zone
series.info: Mesopelagic zone with dim light. Home to bioluminescent creatures and vertical migrators.

series.name: Midnight Zone
series.info: Bathypelagic zone in complete darkness. Permanent residents include giant squid and anglerfish.

series.name: Abyssal Zone
series.info: High-pressure environment with sparse lifeforms. Temperatures near freezing throughout.

series.name: Hadal Zone
series.info: Trench ecosystems fueled by chemosynthesis. Includes deepest known ocean point (Challenger Deep).

visualization_explanation: The dataset represents a univariate distribution of ocean depth zones with five ordinal categories. Synthetic thickness values (μ=2000m, σ=1500m) follow real-world bathymetric proportions while maintaining whole-number consistency. Color progression uses a blue gradient with 0.8 opacity to maintain Tufte's data-ink ratio while encoding depth through luminance. The stacked format leverages Cairo's position-on-common-scale principle for comparing categorical proportions. Data labels use direct annotation to eliminate legend dependencies, and monochromatic grouping maintains visual hierarchy. Tooltips provide ecological context while maintaining clean geometric representation of zone thickness relationships.
